arm_group.description: postoperative conformal radiotherapy for Masaoka stage II-III B type thymoma
no treatment after radical resection for thymoma

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether postoperative conformal radiotherapy are
      effective in the treatment of Masaoka stage II-III B type thymoma.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Conformal Radiotherapy for Stage II-III B Type Thymoma

detailed_description.textblock:
The role of postoperative radiotherapy in thymoma is controversial. Some retrospective
      studies were for the radiotherapy, but others were against. However, more inherent biases
      existed in these trials. Resection, Masaoka stage and pathology were widely accepted as the
      prognostic factors for thymoma. Furthermore, the frequency of local failure after radical
      resection was still high in Masaoka stage II-III B type thymoma. With the conformal
      technique appearing, conformal radiotherapy can escalate the dose without increasing the
      risk of normal tissue toxicities.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 18-75, Zubrod-ECOG-WHO  0-2, the interval of surgery to radiotherapy < 2months,
             Masaoka stage II-III and WHO B type thymoma

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  No second primary tumor, no serious comorbidity, no neoadjuvant anticancer treatment,
             no adjuvant chemotherapy.

intervention.description: postoperative conformal radiotherapy for Masaoka stage II-III B type thymoma

facility.name: Cancer hospital, Chineses Academy of Medical Sciences

clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-institutional, Randomized Controlled Trial of Postoperative Conformal Radiotherapy for Stage II-III B Type Thymoma

other_outcome.description: toxicity: including the acute radition-induced lung toxicity and the late lung toxicity at 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 30 and 36 month after radiation or observation
other_outcome.time_frame: within 3 year after the end of all enrollment

other_outcome.description: quality of life: FACT-Lung and EORTC QOL C30 before and after radiation, and at 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 30, 36 months after radiation or observation

overall_official.affiliation: Cancer hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

primary_outcome.description: local control: tumor recurrence in the tumor bed 3 year local control rate: number of patients with tumor recurrence in the tumor bed at 3 years
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 year after the end of all enrollment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: failure-free survivail: the interval from the surgery and the recurrence within or out the tumor bed overall survival: the interval from the surgery and the death or lost of follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 year after the end of all enrollment

collaborator.agency: The 309 Hospital of People's Liberation Army

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
